clinical_study.brief_title: Intravenous Infusion of Lidocaine in Gastroscopy
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Intravenous Infusion of Lidocaine in Sedation for ERCP: a Randomised Placebo-controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: Intravenous infusion of lidocaine significantly reduces incidence of bucking when perfomed gastroscopy.

detailed_description.textblock: This study divide patients into two groups, the patients in lidocaine group will be given lidocaine; the control group will be given placebo .the primary endopiont was to investigate whether intravenous lidocaine can reduce incidence of bucking and movement in sedation of gastroscopy.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Participants are randomly assigned to controll group or lidocaine group. Participants of control group are given placebo while participants of lidocaine group are given lidocaine.

primary_outcome.measure: the incidence of bucking during the procedure
primary_outcome.description: the difference between incidence of bucking of the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: propofol consumption difference between the two groups
secondary_outcome.description: the total propofol dosage consumption between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: the incidence of infusion pain when adminstrated propofol
secondary_outcome.description: the infusion pain devied into no pain, mild pian, and severe pain

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of hypoxia during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Hypoxia, defined as peripheral oxygen saturation <90% for >30 seconds

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of hypotention during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Hypotension, defined as systolic blood pressure <90 mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of breadycardia during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Bradycardia, defined as heart rate <50 beats/min

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety assessed by the rate of required airway management during the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Required airway management such as jaw lifting, mask ventilation, or tracheal intubation in severe hypoxia Required airway management such as jaw lifting, mask ventilation, or tracheal intubation in severe hypoxia

secondary_outcome.measure: endoscopists satisfaction assessed by the performer
secondary_outcome.description: the endoscopists satisfacition score were assessed on a 0-10VAS after the procedure

secondary_outcome.measure: patient satisfaction assessed by the patient
secondary_outcome.description: the patient satisfacition score were assessed on a 0-10VAS 30mins after the procedure
the anesthetist satisfacition score were assessed on a 0-10VAS 30mins after the procedure
pain were measured on a 0-10VAS at arrival in the recovery room ,30min later
fatigue were measured on a 0-10VAS at arrival in the recovery room ,30min later

arm_group.description: the control group will be given the same volume of saline as the experimental group
the experimental group will be given l-1.5mg lidocaine and then 2mg/kg/h

intervention.description: the control group will be given the same volume of saline.
the experimental group will be given 1-1.5mg/kg lidocaine and then 2mg/kg/h

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
patients aged >18 years who were scheduled for ERCP at Qilu hospital.
Exclusion Criteria:
patients with ASA (American Society of Anesthesiologists) Class 4 or 5, pre-existing hypoxemia (SpO2 <90%), hypotension (systolic blood pressure <90 mm Hg), bradycardia (HR<50 beats/min), uncontrolled hypertension (SBP >170 mm Hg, diastolic blood pressure>100 mm Hg), severe renal or liver failure, pregnancy or lactation, allergy to lidocaine, atrioventricular block, epilepsy, and inability to give informed consen
